doc.name: visitedIcon

syntax.example: set the visitedIcon of button to {imageID | imageName}

doc.summary: Specifies an image to display in a button when the button's visited property is true.

examples.example: set the visitedIcon of button "To Do List" to 5499
set the visitedIcon of me to the ID of image "Done"

description.p: Use the visitedIcon property to change a button's appearance when it has been clicked during the current session.
The visitedIcon property is the ID or name of an image to use for an icon. LiveCode looks for the specified image first in the current stack, then in other open stacks.
By default, the visitedIcon property of newly created buttons is set to zero.
When the button has been clicked during the current session, the visitedIcon is displayed within the button's rectangle instead of the icon (if one has been specified).
